Job Title: Design Lead - Global Studio, AMER

Location: Denver, CO

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Art/Creative, Design, Information Technology

Description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.

Job Category

Marketing & Communications

Job Details

About Salesforce

We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.

We are seeking a dedicated and motivated Design Lead with 7+ years experience and an outstanding design portfolio to join our Global Studio team in AMER. The successful applicant will work as part of multi-disciplined creative team. They are self-motivated and able to deliver projects from concept to delivery within tight deadlines, while maintaining relationships with internal partners.

You’ll support immersive outstanding event experiences, digital experiences (i.e. website/motion design), social campaigns, and anything else that might come your way. You have a strong design aesthetic and are able to adapt existing designs into various formats. The ability to be flexible and comfortable with multiple projects is a must. We may also need you to step into the print space from time-to-time, supporting artwork production for events or global brand campaigns.

We’re a worldwide global creative team. As well as your creative peers, you will collaborate with program managers, event managers, and field marketers across the US, Europe, Australia... and beyond.

Salesforce is a great place to work, and you’ll be joining a super talented, highly supportive creative team that love to innovate and have fun. You’ll also be helping to build one of the world’s best and fastest growing brands.

Experience

Minimum 7 years of agency, studio or in-house creative experienceExceptional portfolio of work demonstrating a range of technical and conceptual abilitiesDemonstrated ability to solve problems conceptually, collaboratively, cross-functionally in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environmentExperience preparing files for both digital and print production (i.e; optimizing for web, print-ready mechanicals, etc.)Experience working across global teams is beneficial

Responsibilities

Take existing concepts and adapt to various formats with a strong visual aesthetic Create production-ready print files to be handed off to vendorsSelf-motivated and highly organisedFollow Salesforce brand guidelines and toolkits to stay aligned with evolving brand updatesWork with the Creative Directors, Art Directors, Project Management team and internal clients - in a fast-paced, collaborative workflow

Skills

Highly-proficient in FigmaHighly-proficient in the Adobe Creative suite, in particular AI, PS, ID and AEExcellent motion design skills using AfterEffects.Knowledge of print production and color managementDesigning at speedVideo editing and/or Creative AI image generation experience would be beneficialVector illustration skills would be beneficialAbility to manage deadlines and production scheduling on numerous, concurrent projects

Accommodations

If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.

Posting Statement

At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at www.equality.com and explore our company benefits at www.salesforcebenefits.com.

Salesforce is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.

﻿Salesforce welcomes all.

For Colorado-based roles, the base salary hiring range for this position is $110,600 to $152,200.

Compensation offered will be determined by factors such as location, level, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Certain roles may be eligible for incentive compensation, equity, benefits. More details about our company benefits can be found at the following link: https://www.salesforcebenefits.com.

Experience Level (if available): None
